Upper Major Chest.Function: Flexion, horizontal adduction, internal rotation of the humerus

Medial Major Chest.Function: Adduction, internal rotation of the humerus

Lower Major Chest.Function: Adduction, internal rotation of the humerus

Minor Chest.Function: Protraction and stabilization of the scapula

Anterior Serratus.Function: Protraction and upward rotation of the scapula

Subclavius.Function: Depression and stabilization of the clavicle

Latissimus Dorsi.Function: Extension, adduction, and internal rotation of the humerus

Posterior Serratus.Function: Retraction and downward rotation of the scapula

Lumbar.Function: Extension and lateral flexion of the spine

Upper Trapezius.Function: Elevation, upward rotation, and adduction of the scapula

Medial Trapezius.Function: Retraction and adduction of the scapula

Lower Trapezius.Function: Depression, upward rotation, and adduction of the scapula

Minor Rhomboid.Function: Retraction and downward rotation of the scapula

Major Rhomboid.Function: Retraction and downward rotation of the scapula

Levator Scapulae.Function: Elevation and downward rotation of the scapula

Biceps Long Head.Function: Flexion and supination of the forearm, flexion of the arm

Biceps Short Head.Function: Flexion and supination of the forearm, flexion of the arm

Biceps Brachialis.Function: Flexion of the forearm, weak supination of the forearm

Triceps Long Head.Function: Extension of the arm, adduction and extension of the shoulder

Forearms Flexor Carpi Radialis.Function: Flexion and radial deviation of the wrist

Forearms Flexor Carpi Ulnaris.Function: Flexion and ulnar deviation of the wrist

Gluteus Medius.Function: Abduction, medial rotation, and flexion of the hip joint

Gluteus Minimus.Function: Abduction, medial rotation, and flexion of the hip joint

Gluteus Maximus.Function: Extension, lateral rotation, and adduction of the hip joint

Pelvic Floor.Function: Supports pelvic organs and helps control urination and defecation

Transversus Abdominis.Function: Compresses the abdomen, aids in forced expiration, and stabilizes the spine

Multifidus.Function: Stabilizes the spine and assists in extension, lateral flexion, and rotation of the spine

Articulations: Cartilage of the lower three ribs
Internal Obliques.Function: Compresses the abdomen, aids in forced expiration, and aids in rotation and lateral flexion of the trunk

External Obliques.Function: Compresses the abdomen, aids in forced expiration, and aids in rotation and lateral flexion of the trunk
